definition: to embarrass oneself/to make a fool of oneself
eye/small hole/crux (of a matter)/CL:隻|只[zhi1],雙|双[shuang1]/classifier for big hollow things (wells, stoves, pots etc)
to make an exhibition of oneself/to be a disgrace

sentences.chinese: 醉酒使得这位绅士丢人现眼。

sentences.english: And look at our president. Its a shame on our country.
sentences.chinese: 再看看我们的总理，那简直是让国家丢人现眼。

sentences.english: Say nothing to me to talk about exploration, where the disgraced.
sentences.chinese: 甭谈探在那儿给我现眼了。
醉葡萄酒使得此绅士丢人现眼。

sentences.english: He wanted to put an end to a spectacle that impressed him as being indecent.
sentences.chinese: 他想结束让他感到丢人现眼的场面。

sentences.english: Such behavior will bring you into contempt.
sentences.chinese: 这样的行为会使你丢人现眼。
醉酒使得这位绅士丢人现眼。

sentences.english: But the realy humiliation occurred after they arrived in America.
sentences.chinese: 而真正的丢人现眼还是到了美国之后。

sentences.english: Imagine what it was like to make such a scene in the middle of the dance floor.
sentences.chinese: 想像一下在舞池中央那样丢人现眼的举止。

sentences.english: There is nothing come at me, don't like two virago, make a fool of oneself.
sentences.chinese: 有什么事都冲我来，别像两个泼妇，丢人现眼。

sentences.english: His conduct brought disgrace upon his family.
sentences.chinese: 他的所作所为给他家丢人现眼。

definition: to make an exhibition of oneself/to be a disgrace
to put on airs/to be ostentatious
to show off/to make a display of
shameful/scandalous/to be humiliated/to make a fool of sb or oneself/to make sb lose face
to make a fool of oneself
to show off one's ability/to boast one's merits
